issue.title: Improved Removing Multi-line Comments in _minify_script_style, Fixes #2637

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
I tried to resolve #2637.
I think removing multi-line JavaScript comments in a perfect way, cannot be done easily using regex. Because we need to find out that the comment is in a js string or not. I did it using the `pointer` approach which is used in removing JavaScript inline comments.

issue.title: Fixes Issue #2637

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
resolves #2637
more elegant way to make sure that the comment is not in a js string var
using a simple lookahead to check

body:
I'm getting an error due to this update:

A PHP Error was encountered
Severity: Warning
Message: preg_replace(): Unknown modifier '.'
Filename: core/Output.php
Line Number: 850

Running locally with MAMP (PHP v5.4.10).

Any idea what's going on here?

Rolling back to 88f41dff43e8e787ab553d86715aca130abf9e51 removes the error.

^ getting the error as well...
Using XAMPP (PHP 5.4.4)
I will submit a pull request again....noticed that the delimiter used for the regex is used in the negative lookahead.

@abdmaster Does it get fixed if you alter lines 916,917?

```
// From
&& ! in_array($next, array('\\', '_', '$'), TRUE)
&& ! in_array($prev, array('\\', '_', '$'), TRUE)

// To
&& ! in_array($next, array('\\', '_', '$', '.'), TRUE)
&& ! in_array($prev, array('\\', '_', '$', '.'), TRUE)
```

Also, I assume this happens with the `#` character as well?

P.S.: Please open a new issue next time, closed ones don't draw attention by people who are not already subscribed to them.

@narfbg Ok next time new issue.

And yes that fixes problem with spaces between class names. And also add hash(#) there as spaces before '#' was getting lost as well.

```
&& ! in_array($next, array('\\', '_', '$','.','#'), TRUE)
&& ! in_array($prev, array('\\', '_', '$','.','#'), TRUE)
```

Okay, fixed in this commit: 6614367f62d2cbd9e8f979c9349cd5474b035866
Thanks for reporting and testing it.
